intro: Hylorhipsalis floccosa subsp. pulvinigera, commonly known as the silver tufted spider plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features long, thin leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. This subspecies is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its adaptability to various soil types.
